page.title: 06School Seventy Years Ago
page.content: Mr Wykes told us that he went to the school near the church. There were about l00 children from 3 to l3. They did not go to Harrold or Sharnbrook in those days. The children walked to school. Some walked across the fields from Farndish and Hinwick Lodge. They brought sandwiches for dinner. The others walked home and back. There were no school dinners. In the morning they started school with assembly like us. For morning break the played outside in the street. Sometimes a horse and cart passed but no cars. The small children wrote on slates. The big ones used to read from the Bible and history books. They sang songs about the Empire. The school trip meant walking to the railway station. We go by coach from school. The headmistress had a cane on her desk.
